name: Eumundi Gridley Homestead B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: Just as good as the reviews say! Had a wonderful stay. It was raining and enjoyed laying on the balcony reading and relaxing. Breakfast was outstanding, hosts were friendly, rooms were lovely. What more can I say? Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Homely and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a very pleasent night at Gridley Homestead, Eumundi in October 2010.
reviews.title: Wish we stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandy was absoultley wonderful, the cooked breakfast was perfect. The room was clean and quite. We have promised we will return.
reviews.title: Eumundi Market

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a place! We booked this place from Sweden without any first hand information save from Tripadvisor, and it was great!!! So welcoming, so genuine, so beautiful! A bottle of wine awited us in the room, we enjoyed it out on the terrace outside our room watching the sunset. It is located 5 minutes walk from the market. I am trying to find something bad to say or something to criticize or even mention but there is nothing. This place should have a Guide Michelline mentioning. The breakfast was excellent. Milk, juice, coffee, tea, sausage, egg, potatoes, bread, homemade jams and fruitsalad. Don't eat too much while on the market, you need space left for afternoon tea and homemade cake!
reviews.title: Gracious Hosts, Very Comfortable Home, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Do you need somewhere to store your food bought at the market, no problem!
reviews.title: Better than a 5 star hotel..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Gridley was a lovely place to stay. The hosts are welcoming & attentive & friendly. We had a wonderful time. The two course breakfast was delicious (and included in the price!) the complimentary homemade afternoon tea cake was very appreciated. This is a lovely home away from home.
reviews.title: Lovely, quaint B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Gridley Homestead was such an unexpected pleasure! We attended a wedding in the area and had booked Gridley without doing much reconnaissance. We were delighted to be received by such lovely, warm and welcoming hosts who provided all the comforts of a lovely home without any intrusion on our stay. Our rooms (there were 6 of us) we all very well appointed, with comfortable and cosy beds, and plenty of room.
reviews.title: What a delightful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The included breakfast was just delicious, and the hosts were very flexible with out orders - catering for all our eccentricities. There was easy access to as much tea and coffee you could drink, and a comfortable lounge area with open fire.
reviews.title: A perfect place for a wonderful weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The views from the decks were delightful, and there was plenty of space to just relax, take in the scenery and enjoy a steamy hot drink.
reviews.title: Little Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gridley Homestead was perfectly located for access to the main street, markets, cafes and restaurants, and the hosts were happy to provide local knowledge.
reviews.title: A delightful and beautiful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Gridley Homestead in Mid-January '11. We regularly day-trip to Eumundi as we only live a couple of hours away but it was another experience all together to actually stay in the town. We arrived later than planned on Friday afternoon due to bad traffic around the time of the floods, but Sandy had baked an amazing Date and Walnut slice and had a hot cuppa ready for us. Absolutely Mouth watering!!! Sandy is lovely enough to make a delicious fresh loaf for afternoon tea every day! (2nd day was banana and walnut loaf - YUM!) She showed us around the room and the wrap-around balcony of the beautifully renovated Queenslander. We had dinner in town at Azzurro Cafe, recommended by Sandy - Great food, great service! She even booked it for us. Would definately recommend to people!
reviews.title: Charming + Relaxing Stay with Friendly and Welcoming Hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is less than ten minute stroll into town, but far enough out to not hear a sound at night. Great sleep and very comfortable bed! Nice spacious room and ensuite! FANTASTIC water pressure in the shower!!!!!!!!! Makes a big difference! Sandy even lights nice citronella incense sticks to rid the mozzies if you want to relax on the big veranda over looking the fields and mountains! Stunning!
reviews.title: Restored my faith in B&B's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast the next morning was delicious. Damien is a brilliant chef! Two options of cooked breakfast along with fruit, muesli, juice, toast, coffee and tea. Host was very good at recognising when to have a chat and when to let her guests relax. Could not fault the service. Gave us some info on the Sunshine Coast Hinterland and some scenic drives, which was handy. Was a nice change being able to leave our car at the B&B and take a relaxing walk to the markets, rather than dealing with the search of a car park which you have to pay for ($4). Markets are a must-do if you're in town on Saturday or Wednesday.
reviews.title: Best BB Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went out to the Pub the second night to see some live music. Great night with lots of dancing. If you like to sit down make sure you arrive twenty minutes or so before the first band starts as it fills up. The whole town ends up there - great atmosphere! Breakfast was just as good the second morning and it was awful having to leave and go back to work! =( Could have stayed for a week!
reviews.title: Hospitality at it's best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks for a wonderful stay Sandy and Damien! And thanks for showing us your beautiful, gentle, well-behaved dog!
reviews.title: Have the big breakfast!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent a weekend here with friends (4 couples in all). A lovely charming B&B close to the markets and a 15 minute drive from the Spirit House cooking school.
reviews.title: Lovely hosts, fantastic breakfast, charming B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The breakfast was outstanding and the rooms very comfortable. Lovely verandas to relax with friends. We will stay again
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful B&B - with wonderful hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sandy and Damien are so warm and friendly - it was like going to stay with old friends.
reviews.title: Wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The classic Queenslander homestead is just gorgeous and Sandy has it fitted out beautifully - the beds are so comfy and warm - the living area is so relaxing and has a wood fire which made it so warm and cosy on the chilly (well by Qld standards!) winters night!
reviews.title: Relaxing & Peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011
reviews.text: The coconut slice Damien baked for afternoon tea was to die for and breakfast was out of this world!
reviews.title: We felt completely at home. Soooo relaxing.

description: Gridley Homestead is a beautifully restored traditional Queenslander with four guest rooms, each with a verandah view and a large lounge/dining area with a cosy wood burning fireplace. The homestead is nestled on the edge of the historic village of Eumundi and just a short stroll to the famous Eumundi Markets. Gridley Homestead is country hospitalitiy at its best.
